Package it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.GUIControllers

Class GameTableController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.GUIControllers.GUIController
it.polimi.ingsw.client.GUI.GUIControllers.GameTableController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GUIControllerInterface, UpdatableController
public class GameTableController extends GUIController implements UpdatableController
Class GameTableController implements all the logic behind the Game Table FXML Scene It renders almost all the game elements, handles mouse event handling, sets up various selection effects, deals with player input and sends messages back to the GUI

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Method start initializes all the data structures containing the various game elements to render.
      Specified by:
      start in interface UpdatableController

    • setWaitTurn

      public void setWaitTurn(boolean value)
      Method setWaitTurn sets waitTurn flag If the flag is set to True, the controller will render the gray overlay to prevent player input
      Specified by:
      setWaitTurn in interface UpdatableController
      Parameters:
      value - is used to set waitTurn

    • endGame

      public void endGame()
      Method endGame sets gameFinished flag to True and then renders end game overlay
      Specified by:
      endGame in interface UpdatableController

    • handleErrorMessage

      public void handleErrorMessage(boolean fromServer)
      Method handleErrorMessage replaces the current state prompt with an error message for 2 seconds. This only gets called if the player tries to do an invalid action
      Specified by:
      handleErrorMessage in interface GUIControllerInterface
      Overrides:
      handleErrorMessage in class GUIController
      Parameters:
      fromServer - is a flag eventually used by the controller to decide which error message should be rendered

    • send

      public void send()
      Method send check if something is currently selected and eventually sends to ClientMessageBuilder those parameters to build a message to send to the server accordingly to the current client state. This method gets called when the player clicks on CONFIRM button in the bottom center of the screen If nothing has been selected, an error prompt gets rendered If the player tries to perform an invalid action, an error prompt gets rendered It also handles various selection effects for both the selected items and the CONFIRM button

    • update

      public void update()
      Method update gets from GUI instance the current status of the GameBoard instance and renders all the game elements accordingly. The rendered board depends on the current value of renderedDashboard variable If the current client state is WAIT_TURN or if the game is finished, a gray overlay with a message gets rendered
      Specified by:
      update in interface UpdatableController

    • renderEndGame

      private void renderEndGame()
      Method renderEndGame renders a message in the center of the screen to let the player know that the game is over

    • renderWaitTurnScreen

      private void renderWaitTurnScreen()
      Method renderEndGame renders a message in the bottom center of the screen to let the player know that it's not his turn

    • renderSendButton

      private void renderSendButton()
      Method renderSendButton renders the button used by the player to perform game actions

    • renderIslands

      private void renderIslands()
      Method renderIslands renders all the islands elements, in a circle pattern, to the screen. Each island corresponds to a GUIIsland instance Also,in the rendering loop, all the GUIIslands' events are set and the image reference gets saved

    • renderClouds

      private void renderClouds()
      Method renderClouds renders all the clouds elements, in a circle pattern, to the screen. Each cloud corresponds to a GUICloud instance Also,in the rendering loop, all the GUICloud events are set and the image reference gets saved

    • populateDashboard

      private void populateDashboard(boolean fromClick)
      Method populateDashboard renders all the board elements to the screen. This includes lobby students, table students, teachers' tables and towers. The board to render is chosen accordingly to the value of renderedDashboard

    • renderPersonalityCards

      private void renderPersonalityCards()
      Method renderPersonalityCards renders all the personality cards to the screen.

    • renderDeck

      private void renderDeck()
      Method renderDeck renders all the assistant cards to the screen.

    • clearDeck

      private void clearDeck()
      Method clearDeck removes from the screen all the assistant cards' images It's used to clear the screen before rendering after update

    • renderPlayerButtonName

      private void renderPlayerButtonName(javafx.scene.image.ImageView playerIcon, String playerName)
      Method renderPlayerButtonName renders the text to the bottom of the board buttons

    • renderColorChoiceBox

      private void renderColorChoiceBox()
      Method renderColorChoiceBox renders a ChoiceBox used by some cards, to let player select a specific color to activate the card effect

    • visualizeContextMessage

      private void visualizeContextMessage()
      Method visualizeContextMessage renders, accordingly to the current client state the context message so that the player knows what to do

    • handleSelectionEffect

      public void handleSelectionEffect(javafx.scene.Node n, Clickable type)
      Method handleSelectionEffect renders the selection effect for the selected items This is done only if the selected item's type is in the clickable list of the current client state

    • handleHoverEvent

      public void handleHoverEvent(javafx.scene.Node n, Clickable hoveredElement)
      Method handleHoverEvent renders the hover effect for the item pointed by the mouse cursor This is done only if the hovered item's type is in the clickable list of the current client state

    • onPlayer1Click

      public void onPlayer1Click()
      Method onPlayer1Click renders the board of player 1, which is always the player who is playing the game from this instance of the game. If the rendered board of the player has already been rendered, nothing changes If the player is moving students with drag n drop, nothing changes

    • onPlayer2Click

      public void onPlayer2Click()
      Method onPlayer2Click renders the board of player 2 If the rendered board of the player has already been rendered, nothing changes If the player is moving students with drag n drop, nothing changes

    • onPlayer3Click

      public void onPlayer3Click()
      Method onPlayer3Click renders the board of player 3 If the rendered board of the player has already been rendered, nothing changes If the player is moving students with drag n drop, nothing changes

    • extractMNsteps

      public int extractMNsteps(int islandId)
      Method extractMNsteps returns the distance between the island where mother nature is and the one specified by the island ID parameter
      Parameters:
      islandId - represents the ID of the island to consider in the calculation
      Returns:
      the result of the calculation

    • changeShowedCards

      public void changeShowedCards()
      Method changeShowedCards show/hides the assistant cards played in the current turn or the player's deck cards accordingly to showDeck flag

    • renderCurrentTurnCards

      public void renderCurrentTurnCards()
      Method renderCurrentTurnCards renders the current turn cards

    • clearCurrentTurnCards

      private void clearCurrentTurnCards()
      Method clearCurrentTurnCards removes from the screen all the assistant cards' images played in the current turn It's used to clear the screen before rendering after update
